For row i, the dolls that appear in row i come from:
            - From the row above (i-1) by moving down: each doll at (i-1, y) when moved produces a doll at (i, y).

        Remove a doll at (x,y) -> place a doll at (x,y+1) and (x+1,y). So a doll in row i can come from:
        - A doll at (i, y-1) that was moved right (from (i, y-1) to (i, y) and (i+1, y-1)) -> so the doll at (i, y) comes from a move right from (i, y-1). - A doll at (i-1, y) that was moved down (from (i-1, y) to (i-1, y+1) and (i, y)) -> so the doll at (i, y) comes from a move down from (i-1, y). Therefore, the recurrence for the number of dolls in row i at column y is:

        d += f[z+x] * pow(f[x+1] * f[z-1], m-2, m) * (z!=0)

    This is: 
        term = f[z+x] * pow( f[x+1] * f[z-1], m-2, m ) % m   if z!=0, else 0. And then we add to d. What is this term? It is: f[z+x] / ( f[x+1] * f[z-1] ) mod m.

    But note: 
        C(z+x, x+1) = f[z+x] / ( f[x+1] * f[z+x - (x+1)] ) = f[z+x] / ( f[x+1] * f[z-1] ) 
        because z+x - (x+1) = z-1. So it is C(z+x, x+1).
